channel.description:
so i was just looking around on the forums and i noticed this [img]http://img211.imageshack.us/img211/9740/51826457mt6.jpg[/img]
i am just wondering what it is there for?

item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Of course it is. With all of the code format Nazis on here, they probably constantly pm Moparisthebest about small errors or things around the website. Which pming Mopar might’ve been the best thing to do in such a small case like this. So I guess you’re right James.

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:18, topic:187732”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=250389.msg2102986#msg2102986 date=1205259844]

Looks like a rendering error to me.

By the way, < is less than, not greater than.

Sigh.

Yeah, I meant that. My math sucks.

and browser, it would have enough room. The number of posts would just scooch to left, or the main width will re-align.
It can’t and wouldn’t make a new line unless the table has wordwrapping or the right coding to stay in place, which is simple.

It is bowser… But if this topic is going to turn into a hate/argument topic then moderators please close this now.

And there actually is enough space from the width to have that <0 there. But there is a chance that this is an actual fake image as i have never seen this when i use SMF (Freddies and MITB).

I have tested this on Opera and it was not enough space, but it was that on Firefox.
If someone can recreate the picture and give the Source we have a prove.

Download the ZIP/(HTML) file that is Attached.
Open it in Opera and in FireFox/IE then you will se it different.
[/quote]
You forgot to set the MITB font size.
http://get.bulletro.com/Moparisthebest_Index.zip

enough proof?[/quote]
That i said is that the index site is different in Opera and Firefox.
And that is that in both mine and yours .html.
But can you tell me what 22 letters you add?
And what have you proof for?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

If it was a error, it would make a new line like the picture i posted.

<td class="windowbg" valign="middle" align="center" style="width: 12ex;"><span class="smalltext"> 7220 Posts<br /> 451 Topics <0
In the width here there is no place for <0 after 451 Topics.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:10, topic:187732”]It is fake, if <0 was there it will be like this:

[img]http://i31.tinypic.com/2wgt401.png[/img]
You cannot place <0 after 451 Topics since it is to little place for it.
And that so are on the your picture are to big and wrong font.[/quote]
NOT FAKE.

This may just be a smf error, since those numbers came from the database like this:

<?php
echo($posts[33] . " Posts <br />");
echo($topics[33] . " Topics <br />");
?>

That <0 can be there for any error reason, maybe even

<?php

if($posts[$array] <0) 
{
echo($posts[$array] . " Posts <br />");
echo($topics[$array] . " Topics <br />");
}
elseif($posts[$array] !<0)
{
echo($posts[$array] . " Posts <br />");
echo($topics[$array] . " Topics <br />");
}
?>

Of course that’s probably not it, but who knows what error caused that to be there.

Those topics have a font, maybe 8pted Verdana, that <0 looks different because the default size is like 12pt, and the default font is Arial I think.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:

It is fake, if <0 was there it will be like this:


You cannot place <0 after 451 Topics since it is to little place for it.
And that so are on the your picture are to big and wrong font.

Like sometimes i click the “Read unread replies” link and its opens the page, but a few of the topic titles are the html code is broken and showing. Just refreshed the page and its gone. So it’s probably just a small error the browser makes when opening a page.

Not a big deal anyway I don’t think.
